item.title: Python
item.description: We learned Python in addition to R at the end of our computational biology course. One of my favorite things that we learned is the use of Pandas. Pandas is used for data manipulation and data wrangling. See: import pandas as pd import numpy as np cw=pd.read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/selva86/datasets/master/ChickWeight.csv", index_col=0) print(cw.head()) ## Time Chick Diet ## weight ## 42 0 1 1 ## 51 4 1 1 ## 59 8 1 1 ## 64 12 1 1 ## 76 16 1 1 A cool function in Pandas is describe, which gives some numerical evaluations of the variables in the dataset, including minimum, maximum, mean, and standard deviation.
